text: I'm using the tracking code API to identify visitors on an external site, if I pass along name and company in addition to the email (so that new accounts are created with that info) do I need to do any other additional checks for existing contacts? Will their name/company always be overwritten?

Hey all, is the CMS pages API working to create new pages? Maybe I’m missing something, but in Postman I’m submitting POST requests to `<http://api.hubapi.com/content/api/v2/pages?hapikey=myRealActualKey>` with a minimal json post body, and it seems to be treating it like a GET request and returning a list of existing pages.
Is this a user who is logged into HubSpot or logged into a page hosted by HubSpot?

Hey <@UJQNNKKHN> If you add an `s` to the `http` portion of your URL that should work. What’s happening is our CDN is redirecting your request which doesn’t respect the method so it becomes a GET request
I think that did it, thanks… been banging my head against a wall trying to fix an old script and looks like it was just because of that.
Was that a new change? I think this script worked until recently
It was related to sunsetting old TLS versions: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Developer-Announcements/TLS-1-0-and-1-1-support-is-sunsetting-on-March-8th-2021/td-p/391729>
Hi I'm new to HubSpot API. Is there a .net SDK for API?
is there an easy way to fetch data using api without using hapikey for security purposes
<@UFBNA9K9A> hi! logged in on a private page as a contact. which is invited via listing.
actually I found a way. the next question is there a way to fetch all form submissions of logged in contact without using hapikey
